original_solution_mapping.L1: Tom will be 30 in 5 years so now he is 30-5 = <<30-5=25>>25
original_solution_mapping.L3: At that time, Jared was twice as old as Tom so Jared was 23*2 = 46
original_solution_mapping.L4: Two years have since passed so Jared is now 46+2 = <<46+2=48>>48

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5605.
    Returns: Jared's current age.
    """
    # L1
    tom_age_in_five_years = 30 # Tom will be 30 in five years
    years_until_tom_is_30 = 5 # in five years
    tom_current_age = tom_age_in_five_years - years_until_tom_is_30

    # L2
    years_ago = 2 # Two years ago
    tom_age_two_years_ago = tom_current_age - years_ago

    # L3
    multiplier_twice = 2 # twice as old
    jared_age_two_years_ago = tom_age_two_years_ago * multiplier_twice

    # L4
    jared_current_age = jared_age_two_years_ago + years_ago

    # FA
    answer = jared_current_age
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Tom will be {tom_age_in_five_years} in {years_until_tom_is_30} years so now he is {tom_age_in_five_years}-{years_until_tom_is_30} = <<{tom_age_in_five_years}-{years_until_tom_is_30}={tom_current_age}>>{tom_current_age}
At that time, Jared was twice as old as Tom so Jared was {tom_age_two_years_ago}*{multiplier_twice} = {jared_age_two_years_ago}
Two years have since passed so Jared is now {jared_age_two_years_ago}+{years_ago} = <<{jared_age_two_years_ago}+{years_ago}={jared_current_age}>>{jared_current_age}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Tom will be 30 in 5 years so now he is 30-5 = <<30-5=25>>25
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: At that time, Jared was twice as old as Tom so Jared was 23*2 = 46

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'jared_age_two_years_ago' (value: 46) was reported instead of 'jared_current_age' (value: 48).
